creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: pair of feet with polychrome decoration; dark orange with gold decoration
marks: Signature and Date incised on bottom of each: [\'81 Yuriko]
medium: Porcelain with overglaze enamels and gold
text: Although trained in ceramics at the Kyoto City University of Arts under Tomimoto Kenkichi (1886-1963), Matsuda Yuriko draws her inspiration from the highly decorative tradition of overglaze porcelains produced at the Arita kilns on the southern most island of Kyushu. Rather than using the traditional Arita palette and floral motifs to decorate conventional bowls and vases, Matsuda embellishes female body parts--legs, lips, feet, and buttocks--as well as organic forms such as bell peppers, pears, and apples.
title: Itonamu (Conduct)
